article_text:
“The politics of medicine, morality and free will have collided in an emotional debate over vaccines and the government’s place in requiring them, posing a challenge for Republicans who find themselves in the familiar but uncomfortable position of reconciling modern science with the skepticism of their core conservative voters,” the New York Times reported yesterday.

How in the world did Republicans manage to get themselves cast as...

article_summary:
How in the world did Republicans manage to get themselves cast as...
“The politics of medicine, morality and free will have collided in an emotional debate over vaccines and the government’s place in requiring them, posing a challenge for Republicans who find themselves in the familiar but uncomfortable position of reconciling modern science with the skepticism of their core conservative voters,” the New York Times reported yesterday.
